title: How to make a good technology product from nothing - Quora

response.answer_text: You can’t. You can take an intangible concept and eventually iterate it into real world services and processes. You must do this even at the quantum level of reality since no true vacuum exists; the emptiness of space is filled by a sea of virtual particles popping in and out of existence. Think of yourself as a virtual quark and take it from there. Rick Chapman COO, DiiDit.com Managing Editor and Publisher, Softletter Author: Selling Steve Jobs’ Liver. A Story of Startups, Innovation, and Connectivity in the Clouds” “In Search of Stupidity: Over 20 Years of High-Tech Marketing Disasters” “SaaS Entrepreneur: The Definitive Guide to Succeeding in Your Cloud Application Business”

Tough question to answer! Here are a few tips, emphasizing things people often forget: Make sure you understand deeply the problem you’re solving. You can find a tool on my blog to help you explore the problem space.Make sure your idea can support a viable business if you intend to commercialize it. A Lean Canvas is a great place to start.Create the simplest solution possible, get it to market and adapt to the feedback you get.Find someone who’s made the journey before, e.g., experienced product manager, to help you. Converting an interesting idea into a successful business is EXTREMELY hard. Don’t underestimate the experience and knowledge you’ll need.Good luck!
